Title: The Principles of Psychology
Author: William James
Significance/Topic: The definitive classic that established psychology as a science.

Significance/Topic: Seminal work on behaviorism and operant conditioning.

Significance/Topic: Introduced the concept of Hebbian learning (neurons that fire together wire together).

Significance/Topic: The book that named and defined the field of cognitive psychology.

Title: Vision
Author: David Marr

Significance/Topic: Proposed the modularity hypothesis of the mind.

Title: The Sciences of the Artificial
Author: Herbert A. Simon

Title: Gödel, Escher, Bach: An Eternal Golden Braid
